titleStmt.title: Minutes of the TEI Technical Council
titleStmt.meeting: TEI Technical Council ftf meeting : Victoria, 16‚Äì18 November 2017

sourceDesc.p: Retagged from a WordPress HTML file

revisionDesc.change: Extracted from Word Press article with id post-29042

body.head: TEI Technical Council Fall F2F, 2017-11-16/18 Parkside Hotel, Victoria, BC

list.item: Stylesheets Issues, Stylesheets Issues, Stylesheets Issues
OxGarage
Roma(+JS)
Spring F2F

TEI/Stylesheets Issues that need extended discussions
@mode in ODD see¬†https://github.com/TEIC/Stylesheets/issues/272
Chapter 11 tickets (see¬†http://www.tei-c.org/release/doc/tei-p5-doc/en/html/PH.html¬†)
LingSIG tickets (PS to prepare those)
Council communication channels: use more Slack (but can we make our Slack open for others to read?)
Should SG still cover RELAX NG? (would be good to have LB‚Äôs input)
New Saxon & oXygen plug-in.¬†Breakout Group (MH, SB, JC)
Elections stuff
Processing Model extensions¬†Saturday morning
MT: Publication SIG proposal

JC suggests that 1 day of all TEI Council Face to Face meetings be open to any TEI member. i.e. they should be allowed to attend, contribute thoughts/ideas but not have voting rights if something is voted on.
Periodicals SIG proposal

div.p: Started @ ~09:15.

div.head: #15: opening Council meetings or parts of them
div.p: JC derails the agenda of the meeting for the first 20 minutes by suggesting an ‚Äòeasy‚Äô topic to council members and thus the meeting descends into 20 minutes of chaos and destruction. (Praise Cthulhu!)¬†He does this by suggesting that he wants to open up council business so people can see what goes on by possibly having it be tradition that one day or morning/afternoon of council meetings is open to any TEI member. Broad brainstorming on the role of the council and its practices re openness, transparency, bringing kind of expertise required on the Council (or for the maintenance of TEI) out to the world.

JC: in favor of this because this opens up what the Council does, it‚Äôs a way to bring in new people by showing what we do. EB-this is a way of cultivating wisdom in the community ‚Äì special kind of event ‚Äì for ex. A workshop SB: likes idea, but wants decision to be part of meeting planning. EM: Bring council work to the fore during the Members‚Äô meeting. Schedule conference sessions where we present discussions about important issues: to clarify the way Council deliberates.
MH: Workshop: Council could select 2 or 3 tickets. Go through process of cloning the repo, work on solving the tickets and generating a pull request during the meeting, perhaps.
JC: problem of perception of ‚Äúhigh priesthood‚Äù working in exclusion
RV: we need time to work, and opening Council session to community loses time we need.Have some community-facing workshop or session associated with any F2F meeting.
[ACTION] on HC: will raise this with the board.

div.head: Summary:

list.item: General agreement with JC‚Äôs proposal that we try to open part of the Council meeting ‚Äî not hard policy, but by tradition & custom rather than by requirement.

Program committee reserves panel slot for the Council to discuss real issues for discussion and present them to the membership, discuss motivation, problems, possible solutions, constraints ‚Äì needs to be discussed with the conference committee
Workshop: Council member(s) could propose issues for discussion & deliberation to provide a guided introduction to Council work.

div.p: MT: Are we having problems with any below, if so, to what extent and what are possible actions to take

list.item: opening the meeting, Council records, issue tracking and public discussion
to what extent it is desirable,
are we facilitating it enough or not,

are there any obstacles and what are they
Not enough candidates considering running
Low chances of being elected for non-high profile TEI practitioners [help them write their bios/statements better]
Can we keep ex-Council members involved and working?

Length of terms of Council ‚Äî JC suggested 3 year terms to the Board.
No one seems to be taking notes about this bit.
EM: We maybe don‚Äôt need to change policies, but change our behavior‚Äìto help encourage smooth transitions and guide people to understand Council better?)
Various council members wonder if the russians have hacked the TEI election. EB: The hackers need to be assigned difficult tickets! üôÇ
Have we stopped talking about 3 year terms?
Council hand-raising vote indicates we‚Äôre in favor of moving to 3-year terms‚Äìa suggestion from Council to Board. Not in favor of changing election to mandate new member on Council if not chosen by votes only because it doesn‚Äôt know whether this was a problem or not. Council will investigate (MT leading) to see if this is a real problem based on the data..
Council Chair: Hugh limited to two terms.. HC would like to step down as Chair in Jan 2018 in order to have a year of overlap with his replacement.
Encouraging community participation in Council work

p.hi: Transmission of knowledge essential to TEI maintenance & development

list.item: Workshop (perhaps a regular-ish feat linked to f2f meetings)

div.head: #14 ‚Äì Publications SIG:
div.p: MT with Julia Flanders and Gimena del Rio Riande: to discuss publication options for bringing TEI ODD Processing Model to TAPAS. MH: interested in join as long as it‚Äôs not focused only on the processing model. JC: Concentration should be on publication technologies. Magda urged to write proposal and submit. We all think it‚Äôs a great idea. JC warns that name is ambiguous‚Äìrethink it. (i.e. it isn‚Äôt about ‚Äòpublications‚Äô like journals, or the publishing industry, it is about publishing tei.

head.hi: #16 Council also says yes, approving Periodicals SIG proposal.

div.head: Related: Does there need to be a Council Liaison for this and other SIGs?
div.p: Discussion: Council should make sure new SIG leaders actively reaches out to periodicals TEI projects not represented at meeting(s). EM points out the organizers should be encouraged to reach out to existing projects doing newspapers with TEI. JC: Notes that really the Chair of Council already liaises with the SIGs.
PS suggests to actively approach people/groups who are preparing some larger proposals (to the Guidelines) and name some Liaison from Council

EB: should SIG appoint liaison to communicate to Council (instead of other way around)? Discussion: that‚Äôs really the job of the SIG convener. ‚ÄúAnything you would like me to bring up at the Council meeting.‚Äù Council liaising is difficult to maintain‚Ä¶(What are the logistics?) EB: asks about slack channel agenda item, whether this is related.
SB protests that managing SIGs is not Council‚Äôs role.
PS: We shouldn‚Äôt wait for SIGs to approach us, but actively communicate with SIGs.
HC: Do we need a special label for tickets to be brought to SIG attention?
PS: Council members could check in with inactive issues AND SIGs

JC: Plenty of SIGs don‚Äôt always propose tickets, and we don‚Äôt necessarily need them to stir up new tickets all the time. They are often birds-of-a-feather with similar interests. Not all SIGs‚Äô¬†raison d‚Äôetre¬†is to propose tickets and improve the Guidelines. SIGs like that are perfectly fine also.

HC: Council members could open special tickets could be points of contact for connecting with people/ encouraging people with nascent proposals for Council to act on. Translate concepts to actionable tickets.
What to do about gigantic messy discussions on tickets? Maybe we need better/stable/sustainable places to flesh out ideas.

list.item: Not Google docs so much as Wikis.
Text or Markdown or TEI files committed to GitHub repo.

div.p: Website right now is in no condition to help. Site migration is a serious problem right now.

Resolution: we don‚Äôt really need SIG liaisons. SIGs are centers of activity, but not the only ones, emerging from TEI community. Council members just need to be aware of what‚Äôs going on and open tickets accordingly. Suggestion that we have standing SIG ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs up with the SIGS‚Äù agenda item. Keep an eye on good mechanisms for communication!

div.head: #1: Battleplan for Stylesheets!!!!
div.p: Need to

list.item: Stop fires
Architectural questions: how to maintain Stylesheets for the long term?

div.p: RV: What major issues with current architecture?
HC: They are ingenious and impenetrable: takes a long time to figure out what has to be fixed and where?
If we had ‚Äúsmaller bits that did smaller things‚Äù that might be easier.
RV: Maybe we don‚Äôt need keys any more
JC: remove stuff that‚Äôs legacy of XSL 1
MH: When they worked on JTEI, they broke free of Stylesheets architecture, to Sebastian‚Äôs concern‚Äìbut it was just too difficult to work in that framework.
Markdown <‚Äì> TEI different from DocX . Need to understand the differences.
SB: Worth remembering that converting to DocX isn‚Äôt really Council‚Äôs responsibility.
MT: Can we use ODD proc model to produce the Guidelines? JC: That was Sebastian‚Äôs intention. RV: We‚Äôd need to be able to do this outside of eXist

SB: ‚ÄúRub-a-dub-dub project‚Äù: clean up stylesheets for consistent variable names, consistent location of function definitions. Perhaps prioritize that and look at the results‚Äìis it easier to maintain a cleaned up version. JC: Due date? MT: Clean up, or better direction to do a rewrite?
SB: Perhaps rewrite only the bits we need.
EB: One goal of ‚Äúrub-a-dub-dub‚Äù was to understand the code and its interdependencies better, identify the outdated parts.
PS: Hard to tell what‚Äôs Council‚Äôs responsibility or not here: People rely on these transformations.
JC: ISO paid TEI to produce a seamless transformation to/from DocX. MH: Not clear whose responsibility that was to maintain, but lots of people use.
MH: We need to start with odd2odds.xsl
RV: try rewriting odd2odds from scratch‚Äìconsidering the probs we‚Äôve had with modes, etc.
TEI Website parts that aren‚Äôt Guidelines‚Äìabout to be handled by WordPress?
Summary: MH and RV want rewrite. SB wants clean-up first‚Äìcould be more efficient.;
Functions need documentation of input, output, expected behavior. JC: Lots of this is provided by the auto-generated documentation. Consistent code format would help improve this.
Formatting, variable naming, key naming.
SB could work alone, but EB maintains there ought to be lots of us watching and checking and making sure the documentation is clear. JC: Otherwise we create conditions for a new Sebastian.

Council suggestion is: [ACTION] on SB:¬†Syd works on cleaning and documenting odd2odd.xsl stylesheets reports back in January. Works with frequent pull requests so there is code review. This is a test case to see what the scope of this work is. If he can do this in a reasonable time, it‚Äôs a good sign, others can start to work as well on other stylesheets. Also, Syd might report back on some workflows.

div.head: Afternoon
div.p: 12:00‚Äì13:00: talk with Christian-Emil Ore about Ontology issues:¬†327¬†,¬†1655¬†,¬†367¬†, ‚Ä¶?
We (TEI) are missing elements to describe physical objects and abstract objects. msDesc does this for manuscripts.
So one method is to see if these elements can be generalized. Thus clean up TEI a bit w/ respect to ontological categories.
Another method would be try to make a hierarchy of some TEI elements.

list.item:
Reframe current class system?
Add ‚Äúphilosophical‚Äù class system that supplements current structural system.
‚ÄúInheritance‚Äù system
Mapping TEI to CIDOC (use equiv?): context: Christian has used CIDOC as a model to view/comprehend TEI.
8 classes:
Persons
Events
Place
Time / date
Physical object
Conceptual object
Names
Types
Ontological mapping doesn‚Äôt match TEI prosopography hierarchy, but can be mapped from it.
Abstract object : Christian‚Äôs example: intellectual property rights
What are the use cases for this?
Taxonomy of editorial, authorial, etc. elements?
Could contribute to conformance
Formalizing abstract model
msDesc: Description of ms object to appear in an object-ography‚Äìan object container, or a history container‚Ä¶
Separating out discussions of listObject & listEvent (we still want to be able to distinguish bw lists of objects & the events that happen to them)
What‚Äôs wanted: Change the TEI to express places, objects, etc. in a more ‚Äúontologically sound‚Äù way
Relevant issue to be reopened (or open a new one with reference to original):https://github.com/TEIC/TEI/issues/327
[ACTION] on JC¬†has re-opened and self-assigned this to at least come up with a draft proposal for listObject objectName and object elements.
Rationalize content models for place & person (could be rabbit hole), and there is already a ticket about it.
Find low hanging fruit instead
Should we review elementSpecs and add equivalences w/ @equiv?
Mapping to CIDoc wouldn‚Äôt ensure by itself consistency of TEI abstract model
Consult Fabio Ciotti‚Äìprior mapping efforts?
Summary: C.-E.O. will have a look into how to introduce object, object description, conceptual object and conceptual object description, and how they compare to msDesc also 2nd thing, look into hierarchy of TEI classes and how it compares with conceptual content of elements.

div.p: Lunch: MH and SB suggest the Old Spaghetti Factory. The Ghost of Lou revulses in horror. RV refuses to return to this monstrosity after council visited it in this instance.
MT gathers data on elections in 2002-2017 period and gives some tentative answers:

list.item: 94 individuals running up for the Council, 35 women
43 individuals have been elected, 14 women
http://admin.exist-db.org:44455/exist/apps/tei-elections/index.html¬†Photo by¬†http://www.fourframesphotobooth.com/
Group A (SB, MH, JC),¬†FIXED THE BUILD, 174, 175, 294

div.p: The council sang Happy Birthday to its chair, HC.

list.item:
Should we still cover RELAX NG in¬†SG¬†?
Add information on PureODD ‚Äì add new section. Or mention and point to the chapter.
Should cover RELAX NG.
How much do we want to overhaul this chapter? EB
Probably not much because of its popularity SB
[ACTION] on EB¬†will do ‚Äì light editing, addition re ODD
Open issue for this:¬†https://github.com/TEIC/TEI/issues/1708

div.head: #4: Spring face to face meeting discussion

list.item: If Cologne, start Fri 23rd till Monday Feb. 26 in conjunction with German DH conference. Have it run before the conference‚Äìconference ends Fri. 2018-03-02.
Paderborn an option around Mar 5
JC could facilitate a meeting in Newcastle and might try to tempt some council members to Newcastle if they are in Europe.
MT happy to find a place in Warsaw but since we have many candidates already let‚Äôs reserve that for next year

we aren‚Äôt as familiar with its workings as we should be. MT: It could be much shorter and easier to maintain in XQuery ‚Äì could split out schema creation part from format generation parts (used by people outside TEI Council) ‚Äì

Possibilities:
OxGarage alongside simpler eXist wrapper for ODD-related stylesheets to provide customization API (primarily for Roma, but also the world)
Same as above + try and salvage Java code from OxGarage and integrate in eXist app via Java bindings
JC noted that the¬†http://www.man.poznan.pl/online/en/¬†were the people responsible for building the original ENRICH-EGE¬†https://sourceforge.net/projects/enrich-ege/?source=directory¬†which we developed into OxGarage. They may be willing to look at it again for us, but I doubt it.
PS: OxGarage actually does its job well and it‚Äôs good to show stability in regards to TEI transformations to other formats.
RV suggests to keep OxGarage but still create a separate ‚ÄúODD customization API‚Äù (basically solution (i) above).
PS: or just fix that bug that RV found of RomaJS

[ACTION] on PS and RV¬†to locate the OxGarage bug¬†(we found a workaround on Nov 18)¬†and figure out validation, but wait for a second bug before developing a new ODD customization API. MT requests you please take notes on what you find. MH: triage the Stylesheets tickets on OxGarage.

Slack: can it be public? ‚Äî seems to be ‚Äúno‚Äù, but we could make an archive public
Use it for issue discussion?
We already have 3 channels (TEI-L, tei-council, issue itself)
We can archive it
Example:¬†https://levels.io/slack-export-to-html/
RV had connected GitHub to #random; group prefers to make a separate channel for git ‚Äî RV did so. Yay.
SB: New Saxon & oXygen plug-in is needed‚Äìmaybe discuss this in breakout group. MH: Someone on Council needs to be watching the oXygen plugin alongside him.

experiment to outsource to non-Council workgroup. MS shepherds (RV included in correspondence. Be in touch with new convener of MS SIG (McCormick). SB: suggests we organize a workgroup w/ Gerrit. HC: We want to encourage Gerrit and others like him to work with Council members, doing pull requests etc. It does a lot of the modification and improvement work up front, allows Council to review at the pull request stage.
[ACTION] on MS¬†to email Gerrit and get this started (cc RV, McCormick(?), and Martin de la Iglesia)

div.head: #8: PS:¬†Docker proposal

list.item: Could be built on AWS, or any institution that will host Docker. (MH: UVic won‚Äôt permit Docker.) EB just applied for an account here to build Jenkins at Pittsburgh Supercomputing Center, to install Jenkins in Docker. Maybe good for testing stuff! If approved, can add any of us to the account who wants to play with it:¬†https://www.psc.edu/images/xsedetraining/BridgesMarch2016/VM_Dockers.pdf
See existing containers at¬†https://hub.docker.com/r/teic/

div.p: [ACTION] on PS: Peter will build the various docker containers. Various people can host.

list.item:
TEI Issues:
Add more elements to att.spanning with schematron constraint
closed
Change description of TEI Header and simplify content model of TEI
tweaks to the prose need to be done
clarify how to encode short-form citations
see proposal group C
Add new element unit
otiose remarks on abbr
drop first sentence of the remark
Remove or rewrite TEI-Minimal

TEI Issues:
Encoding of Standoff annotations¬†:¬†punting to PS and Laurent (linkSig ticket)
Allow relation to occur intermittently within parent elements¬†Can Syd follow up on the backwards-compatibility issues (if there are any) here?

item.ref: `path` should exist alongside `zone` for non-closed areas in facsimile

list.item: Discussion: `zone` has capacities to demarcate a 2-dimensional area. Note: 1453, 1474, and 1508 are part of a cluster. We could open discussion to ask, ‚ÄúDo we still need this?‚Äù Do we have a need for an @path on zone? In what way is IIIF related/potentially helpful?
Issue: we can draw polygons (closed shapes) in TEI, but don‚Äôt support open paths.
Recommendation: Perhaps we close this ticket until we have more people working on relation between images and text.
What about a child element pointer inside zone?
FURTHER DISCUSSION: revisit the proposal to handle this with @points: to permit describing an open shape without completing closure.
Possibly @closed=‚Äùyes‚Äù | ‚Äúno‚Äù OR handle with separate @path vs. @points

item.ref: zone used with JSON, etc: need examples in Guidelines

list.item: (Subgroup originally thinks: Give them their attribute (@pointsRef) )
RV: We should ask IIIF group to take a look at this proposal. Interoperability with IIIF might be enhanced by working with this ticket.
Decision: Ask IIIF to weigh in on this ticket.

item.ref: Schematron inside ODD files should be more precisely specified

list.item: It is very convenient just to put the schematron information in elementSpec and not add extra markup like <sch:rule> but need to weigh against effort of deriving constraint info. Syd ‚Äì pls address in the meeting. Decision: reconsidered by SB and MH: close the ticket.

div.head: Group C: (RV, HC, MT)

list.item:
TEI Issues:
rationalize content models of org and place and person
Mark status: blocked
clarify how to encode short-form citations
Use <bibl corresp>
See also #1579
Description of textNode is insufficient
SB to revise; new ticket for content
Expand att.notated to all elements commonly used in linguistic markup: quote, s, cl, phr, w, m, c, seg
Made green, prodded AB
Attribute classes in ‚Äòtei‚Äô when they shouldn‚Äôt be?
Possibly just move this class, while doing inventory, too?
Need to add a check for internal referential integrity on the Guidelines HTML
Added MH in hope he‚Äôs willing to help

div.p: (Got to here by 16:21)

list.item: Marked as green
Marked as green, do proposal
Marked as green
Marked as green

item.ref: shouldn‚Äôt each constraintSpec (or each constraint) map onto a *single* pattern?

list.item: Marked as green
JC to go away and test
Asked original poster for a real-life example to work out best solution

some¬†[Note: not even sure this needs discussion. I just need to find instances of this flavor of problem and fix them. I think I wanted to ask if we could say referencing position of notes related to examples is a bad practice in the style guide?]¬†mix-ups expanding upon examples in specs
SS should proceed

item.ref: q should be allowed in span

list.item: Not sure.

item.ref: shouldn‚Äôt the presence of @target or @cRef be made mandatory on ref?

list.item: No no no, there are plenty of references that are only prose-based, and you do not need to have a target on ref; Close.
Excellent idea.
Needs more discussion. Connected to¬†#1461¬†(above)
Green: We‚Äôre go to make a proposal: we like the concept of unitDecl in header; idea of unit as child is problem: we think unitDef is better.

div.head: Group B: (EB, SS, EM, PS)

list.item: Subgroup: Just use list or msItem in msContents. Address MHolford‚Äôs later comment. Ask James about what he intends.
Decision: change content model to add additionNote inside additions
Skip for now ‚Äì followup meeting

item.ref: Status of Schematron rules in TEI

list.item: Where do we clarify or state what schematron implies conformance (Is it Ch. 23?) ‚Äì ask MH to clarify 23.4.3.1 Semantic Constraints
EB is for MH‚Äôs position 2: Why would Sch warnings pose a problem? We can simply state these don‚Äôt break conformance.
SB: We only have 9 Schematron rules that issue non-fatal warnings
Requesting more details from Piotr.
EB: Note: This wouldn‚Äôt be parallel to use of listPerson, because it permitted in particDesc (not profileDesc). We‚Äôd need something analogous to particDesc to contain listBibl.
PS: I‚Äôm with Hugh(?) to say we‚Äôre postponing this for stdOff and in the meantime use sourceDesc rather than introducing further interim solutions
Ticket¬†#374¬†needs to be implemented to deal with this problem‚Äìto implement linkedDataBlock (or linkDataBlock)

div.p: ===Group stopped here===

item.ref: seal element description should be expanded to other authentication mechanisms
Things we‚Äôd like to do in ODD which haven‚Äôt been implemented yet

list.item: Don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything to do here, but maybe we should chat about it, and whether we need a ticket category for ‚Äú√ºber-tickets‚Äù
Maybe an ‚ÄòODD Development‚Äô category?

item.ref: The namespace URI http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0 cannot be dereferenced

list.item: Sadly blocked
Closed

item.ref: examples and suggested values of unit= don‚Äôt match

list.item: Agree with SB

item.ref: description of classDecl needs revision, perhaps examples

list.item: RV, MH, and SB to provide an example

item.ref: model.physDescPart is declared in the wrong module

list.item: Agree with James, he is so clever, so blocked
We need to agree on a deadline for the ontologies proposal, so we can a) prod for delivery of the report and/or b) unblock and implement dependencies if it won‚Äôt be delivered in a timely fashion.

item.ref: Guidelines Appendices should include a list of pending deprecations

list.item: Mark green

item.ref: Add listRef to model.ptrLike (and expand its description slightly)

list.item: Mark green and go with SS‚Äôs 1st solution
Content model of choice is too permissive¬†[Note: Just fixed this one, hope that is ok.]¬†[Note: No, we‚Äôre all really angry with you.]¬†[Note: more than ok, in fact]

Description of move is misleading¬†[Note: Done]
Mark green and yes to (c)
Finished yesterday‚Äôs tickets
SB Suggests we have a dedicated teleconference to work out this issue.¬†ACTION ITEM: RV sets up phone call.
Looking at¬†Stylesheets #272
But this is not just a stylesheets issue
Just issues or repos?
Issues and Release artifacts (the binaries we upload) don‚Äôt persist if the repo is destroyed.
Distinction between preservation of history vs. disaster recovery

MH: A Jenkins job could backup the Issues once per day. RV: There‚Äôs an API for that. use curl. Keep today, yesterday, and 2 weeks ago. Try setting this up on each Jenkins server to run on different days. ACTION ITEM: MH to set this up.¬†JC added script pointer on Slack https://github.com/TEIC/TEI/issues/1714
SB: refrigerate ~17‚Äì24 Jan, freeze ~25‚Äì31 Jan, release on Wed 31 Jan
MS release manager, HC release tech

item.ref: Allow external parameters to be defined globally (#7)
Pass general parameters to processed descendants (#8)

div.head: #3: Roma report
div.p: RV runs through roadmap. Touches on areas where he needs help (OxGarage, design). Continue to organize regular meetings explaining what he‚Äôs been doing. Useful for RV to stay on track.

p.ref: RomaJS report from the members meeting

list.item: Keep Council meetings on Thursdays at 09:00 Eastern US
SB will change Stylesheets meetings at some point to Tuesdays at 09:00 Eastern US

div.head: #11: oXygen Plugin (again)

list.item: MH: Needs to be updated to later version than 15

Names of ODD schema ‚Äì (for delivery on Exemplars page)
Subset | Assistant | Assisted | TEI_Customisation_Assistant
Extension | Here-be-dragons | *unqualified* | tei_odds

div.p: Amber tickets we didn‚Äôt cover:

item.ref: seal element description should be expanded to other authentication mechanisms
Things we‚Äôd like to do in ODD which haven‚Äôt been implemented yet

list.item: Don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything to do here, but maybe we should chat about it, and whether we need a ticket category for ‚Äú√ºber-tickets‚Äù
Maybe an ‚ÄòODD Development‚Äô category?

div.head: Ticket and Pull Request Triage on TEI and Stylesheets Repos
Afternoon
div.p: We‚Äôll have the room all day. Several of us will be departing in the afternoon, so general business should stop by 2‚Äì2:30, but those who are staying can keep working on tickets if they want.

div.head: #7: LingSig discussion
div.p: Ling Sig trying to bring linguists back into the TEI fold. Motivates the issues they are submitting. Have clone repo of their own and are sending pull requests to TEI
Examining #1670 ‚Äì very detailed.
General feeling in the room was that:

list.item: We very much like the addition of att.linguistic
Yes, put @lemma and @lemmaRef in it
We think @pos and @msd are fine
We think @join is fine but wonder if a different name could be used, or is that exactly what this is called in ISO 24611?
We think @reg would violate the principle of free range text in an attribute value, and see very little need for it, anyway.

div.p: NOTE:¬†We decided to use the combination of ‚ÄúGo‚Äù and ‚ÄúNeeds discussion‚Äù labels to indicate that the assignee is cleared to do more work on an issue, we expect it to move forward, but we expect more discussion before it is a ‚ÄúGo‚Äù to put into the¬†Guidelines.
Ended ~16:37
HC has a 4:45pm flight
JC (Flight AC 8080), EM and EB have 8:40pm flight taxi at 6ish from Marriott
SB leaves Sun 11-19 10:00 (from harbor)
